weekly_top_story.headline: Phelps Health in Rolla, Missouri to Double Emergency Room Size to Support Rural Care
weekly_top_story.summary: Amid ongoing rural hospital closures, Phelps Health is investing $60 million to more than double its emergency department size by 2027, addressing critical gaps in rural emergency care in Missouri.

stories.headline: Government Shutdown Impacts Medicare and Community Health Funding; Temporary Claims Hold Implemented
stories.summary: The 2025 partial federal government shutdown has caused lapses in funding for key health programs and enacted a 10-business-day temporary Medicare claims payment hold, potentially delaying reimbursements for physicians.

stories.headline: Medicare Telehealth Waivers Expire Leading to Return of Pre-Pandemic Restrictions
stories.summary: As of October 1, 2025, Medicare reinstates pre-pandemic restrictions on telehealth services, limiting broad coverage for audio-only visits and requiring patients to be in approved geographic locations, impacting access for rural and federally qualified health centers.
